derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hrēod, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch riet and German Ried

entry.def: Reeds are tall plants that grow in large groups in shallow water or on ground that is always wet and soft. They have strong, hollow stems that can be used for making things such as mats or baskets.
A reed is a small piece of cane or metal inserted into the mouthpiece of a woodwind instrument. The reed vibrates when you blow through it and makes a sound.

means.word_mean: 1. tall woody perennial grasses with hollow slender stems especially of the genera Arundo and Phragmites
2. a vibrator consisting of a thin strip of stiff material that vibrates to produce a tone when air streams over it;

sentences.sentence: "the clarinetist fitted a new reed onto his mouthpiece"

means.word_mean: 3. a musical instrument that sounds by means of a reed
